Title: ECOWAS to slash airfare, eliminate taxes by January
Summary: ECOWAS to slash airfare, eliminate taxes by January 1, 2026 . Air ticket taxes across West Africa will be removed and air fares slashed by over 20 per cent . This formed part of a sweeping regional policy to make air travel affordable and strengthen economic activities .

Title: 54 taxes, charges account for 35% of airfare cost, stifle traffic demand
Summary: 54 taxes, charges account for 35% of the airfare cost in Nigeria . The journey to achieving affordable air travel has been complicated by fiscal hurdles .

Title: FEC endorses new industrial policy, okays electric buses, BOI HQ, others
Summary: Federal Executive Council (FEC) approved five major memoranda from the Ministry of Industry, Trade and Investment, including Nigeria’s long-awaited Industrial Policy 2025 . FEC endorses new industrial policy, okays electric buses, BOI HQ, others .

Title: The 21st-century public administrator in a democratic context
Summary: It is this very attempt at preserving the professional capacity of the public servant that necessitates the need to prevent the politicisation of public servant . The 21st-century public administrator in a democratic context must be seen as a public administrator .

Title: Minister woos investors with $50m lithium processing plant, others
Summary: Minister of Solid Minerals Development, Dr. Dele Alake wooed investors in London, United Kingdom, UK, with $50 million lithium processing plant . As Nigeria records over $2bn inflow to lithium, others   By Gabriel Ewepu .

Title: Total pension fund assets rise 2.2% to N26. 6trn
Summary: Total pension fund assets under the Contributory Pension Scheme, CPS, increased by 2.2 per cent, month-on-month, MoM to N26.66 trillion in October 2025 . National Pension Commission, PenCom, disclosed this yesterday in the unaudited report on pension funds industry portfolio .

Title: Dollar to Naira exchange rate today, December 11, 2025
Summary: The exchange rate between the Naira and the US Dollar remained relatively stable across major foreign exchange windows today, Thursday, December 11, 2025 .

Title: Petrol supply from Dangote Refinery rises 38% to 23.5m litres daily
Summary: Domestic supply of Premium Motor Spirit (PMS), commonly known as petrol, rose by 37.7 percent in November 2025 . Imports hit 52m litres per day . Petrol supply from Dangote Refinery rises 38% to 23.5m litres daily .

Title: ECOWAS moves to cut air travel cost in Nigeria, others
Summary: The Economic Community of West African States has approved major changes aimed at reducing the high cost of flying within Nigeria and the entire West Africa region . The Commission said Heads of State and Government had, at their December 2024 summit in Abuja, adopted a measure that will reduce air travel costs .

Title: Police probe viral video of officer mobbed over theft allegation
Summary: The Lagos State Police Command has launched an investigation into a viral video showing a uniformed officer being assaulted by a mob over an allegation of stealing . The video, which began circulating on Wednesday, captured the officer with blood pouring from his mouth as he sat on the ground surrounded by an angry crowd . The officer, still in his uniform

Title: CAC introduces new mandatory requirements for business name online updates
Summary: The Corporate Affairs Commission has introduced new compulsory requirements for all business name online update requests, effective immediately . Applicants must now provide additional personal and contact details to strengthen verification processes and enhance record accuracy for registered businesses . The commission urged proprietors to comply with the updated guidelines to avoid delays in processing their requests .

Title: ECOWAS must enforce zero tolerance for coups, says Sierra Leone’s foreign minister
Summary: The Sierra Leone’s Minister of Foreign Affairs and Chairman, ECOWAS Council of Ministers, Timothy Kabba, has called for zero-threat tolerance against unconstitutional change of government among the member states . Title: I love PDP but defected to protect myself – Adeleke
Summary: Ademola Adeleke defended his defection from the Peoples Democratic Party to the Accord Party . He said he did not abandon the PDP, which he still holds in high regard, but chose to prioritise continuity in Osun’s development . The governor said residents of the state are “wiser” and

Title: 2025 AFCON: Things to know about Nigeria's Group C opponents
Summary: The 2025 Africa Cup of Nations kicks off in Morocco on December 21, 2026 . The tournament is the first to be played over Christmas and New Year . Hosts Morocco play Comoros at the Prince Moulay Abdellah Stadium in Rabat at 19:00 GMT . Nigeria have been drawn in Group C, alongside Tunisia,
